title: WRFL's 30th Birthday Bash!
admission_fee: Student Tickets: $15   -    General Admission: $20 - Sunday is a free show!
brief_description: WRFL presents their 30th Birthday Bash happening March 2 through March 4 at The Burl.
description:
WRFL presents their 30th Birthday Bash happening March 2 through March 4 at The Burl. The weekend offers a chance for station alumni and current DJs to meet and share their experiences programming Lexington, Kentucky's "Only Alternative Left":


Friday, March 2nd:

Washed Out

Helado Negro

Idiot Glee


Saturday, March 3rd:

Cults

Ellie Herring

Hair Police

Devine Carama

<> After-party Time w/Thank You for Coming to Our Parties


Sunday, March 4th:

10 Foot Pole

Nine Pound Hammer

Lovely Grandmas

More TBA


Presale: A limited amount of tickets will be available for students and WRFL Alumni starting 1/15/2018 at 12:01 am

- boxoffice.uky.edu

- Student Presale Code: WRFLStudent

- You will need a valid student ID to present with your ticket at the show

- Alumni Presale Code: Please see the WRFL Alumni Group for details

General Sale: Available January 20th at boxoffice.uky.edu

Pricing for Washed Out and Cults:


Sunday is a free show! It’s going to be bananas so come early and stay late!

title: WRFL 30 with Tim & Massey Ferguson
brief_description: Kentucky for Kentucky invites RFLiens of all eras (and all other interested party peeps) to mingle and refuel between WRFL's 30th Birthday afternoon happenings at the Downtown Arts Center and nighttime throwdown at The Burl
description:
Location: The Fun Mall (KYforKY headquarters), 720 Bryan Ave (between N. Limestone & E. Loudon)

Time: 5-8pm, music at 6pm

Admission: FREE, all ages welcome

Sponsored by Kentucky for Kentucky, www.kyforky.com


Saturday, March 3, Kentucky for Kentucky invites RFLiens of all eras (and all other interested party peeps) to mingle and refuel between WRFL's 30th Birthday afternoon happenings at the Downtown Arts Center and nighttime throwdown at The Burl.


Pizza (including vegetarian and vegan options) and non-alcoholic beverages will be provided. Those of proper age are welcome to BYOB.


Pizza feasting begins at 5pm. Live music kicks in at 6pm, with Massey Ferguson / Tim, a mash-up of two bands that ruled Lexington's indie scene and RFL's airwaves in the mid/late-90s.


Questions? Contact Ross Compton at prcompton@gmail.com WRFL 88.1 FM Radio Free Lexington

title: Transylvania Liberal Arts + Feminism Wikipedia Edit-a-thon
brief_description: Join us for a communal updating of Wikipedia entries on subjects related to the liberal arts and feminism. We will provide tutorials for the beginner Wikipedian, reference materials, and refreshments.
description:
Wikimedia’s gender trouble is well-documented. While the reasons for the gender gap are up for debate, the practical effect of this disparity, however, is not. Content is skewed by the lack of female participation. This represents an alarming absence in an increasingly important repository of shared knowledge.


Let’s change that. Join us for a communal updating of Wikipedia entries on subjects related to the liberal arts and feminism. We will provide tutorials for the beginner Wikipedian, reference materials, and refreshments. Bring your laptop, power cord, and ideas for entries that need updating or creation. People of all gender identities and expressions are encouraged to participate.


Please create a Wikipedia account before the event. You can learn how to do that here:

https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Special:CreateAccount&returnto=Main+Page


On the day of the event, please sign in to our Dashboard: https://outreachdashboard.wmflabs.org/courses/Transylvania_University/Transylvania_Liberal_Arts_and_Feminism/home

title: Artist Talk: LAVISH! New Work by Zoé Strecker
brief_description: The Lavish! installation sculpture by Zoé Strecker is a long-term project that features community-embroidered images of natural communities and organisms in the forests on Pine Mountain in the southeastern Kentucky
description:
February 23 – April 2, 2018

Artist Talk: LAVISH! New Work by Zoé Strecker

The Lavish! installation sculpture by Zoé Strecker is a long-term project that features community-embroidered images of natural communities and organisms in the forests on Pine Mountain in the southeastern Kentucky. Stitched by volunteer embroiderers from across the country, the printed silk organza panels, hang within a circular, bent wood structure (22’ diameter by 10’ 4” high). This exhibition engages sight, sound, and smell and includes an active embroidery studio as well as a side exhibition titled “Inspired by Wild Places,” featuring the work of selected members of the Pine Mountain Collective: Rebecca Allan, Vallorie Henderson, Erika Strecker and Brian and Sara Turner.

PRESS RELEASE

Special Events and Hours

All events are free, open to the public, and occur in Morlan Gallery---located on the main floor of the Mitchell Fine Arts Center.

Opening Reception for the Artists | Friday, February 23, 5-7 p.m., Morlan Gallery

Weekend Hours | Sunday, February 25, 6:30 -7:30 p.m., Morlan Gallery

Art Talk with Zoé Strecker | Thursday, March 8, 6 p.m., Morlan Gallery

Lexington Gallery Hop | Friday, March 16, 5-8 p.m., Morlan Gallery

Wild Things: Selected Artists from the Pine Mountain Sessions | Friday, March 23, 7-8:30 p.m., Carrick Theater, Mitchell Fine Arts Center. Kentucky musicians Daniel Martin Moore and Julia Purcell will perform original works, and poet and novelist Mary Ann Taylor-Hall will give a reading. Additionally, Rebecca Allan will give a short gallery talk in Morlan followed by a reception.

title: Prints & Pints
brief_description: Join Bluegrass Printmakers at Pivot Brewing for an art sale and free kids printmaking demo
description:
Join Bluegrass Printmakers at Pivot Brewing for an art sale and free kids printmaking demo. We'll offer LEGO block printing and monotype printing with Lyra crayons. Kids can take home their art that day. You can also purchase prints from various artists. Bluegrass Printmaker Matt Reno will be Pivot and Fowl County's March Artist of the Month.


This event is free and open to the public. Any donations collected will support Bluegrass Printmakers' efforts to continue spreading art throughout the Lexington community.


Learn more about Bluegrass Printmakers at bgprintmakers.org and on social media at @bgprintmakers.

title: Pressing Entomology Opening Reception
brief_description: Bluegrass Printmakers Cooperative is curating Pressing Entomology, an exhibition in collaboration with Sisohpromatem Art Foundation, Inc. based on the exploration of metamorphosis as it relates to insects by means of printmaking
description:
Bluegrass Printmakers Cooperative is curating Pressing Entomology, an exhibition in collaboration with Sisohpromatem Art Foundation, Inc. based on the exploration of metamorphosis as it relates to insects by means of printmaking.


There will be a performance by Central Music Academy and light refreshments will be served.


(print by: Joanne Price, Parasitoid Wasp I Braconidae)

title: Thriving Artists Series: OPPORTUNITIES
brief_description: This series is comprised of three candid conversations about the internal and external motivations for making art.
description:
This series is comprised of three candid conversations about the internal and external motivations for making art. No matter what medium you use or what your level of success may be, there are still ways to clarify your artistic vision and achieve more visibility. The UK Art Museum can help. Director Stuart Horodner will serve as facilitator for the series. 

OPPORTUNITIES 

Opportunities are everywhere, they are taken and bestowed. Do you know what they are and how to get them? We will share strategies for finding out about what is available, focusing on regional and national possibilities and how to best take advantage of them.

Each event is 6-8 pm at the UK Art Museum. FREE



Questions? Contact Kate Sprengnether at ksprengnether@uky.edu or 859. 257.6218

title: Blood of the Wolf Fest IV
brief_description: Wolven Brotherhood and Dark Nights proudly present
description:
Wolven Brotherhood and Dark Nights proudly present:


BLOOD OF THE WOLF FEST IV


Presale tickets are now available for purchase! They will be available through the first half of March after which, entry will be at the door on a first come first serve basis until capacity is reached.


Presale tickets are WILL CALL only. The name attached to payment is what will be on the list unless otherwise noted by buyer. Valid ID required at door. Tickets are non refundable but transferable.


Entry to prefest is completely separate from the main festival admission and will be available at the door only.


Blood of the Wolf Fest will be 18 and up but will include an additional charge of $10 per day at the door for anyone under the age of 21 attending this event.

title: Leonard Cohen Tribute Encore
brief_description: Hallelujah: The Leonard Cohen Tribute is back by popular demand
description:
Hallelujah: The Leonard Cohen Tribute is back by popular demand at the Lyric Theatre on April 28. Tickets are on sale at the Lyric Theatre box office: www.lexingtonlyric.tix.com and 859-280-2218.


The sold-out November 2017 show featured 35 Central Kentucky artists coming together in 13 acts to bring their considerable talent and respect to Cohen’s incomparable catalog. Two new performers will join the original artists in the reprise: 17-year old multi-instrumentalist and soulful vocalist, Daisy Helmuth, and Paul K, a staple of the Lexington blues and folk scene in the 90’s.


Original artists include One Lane Bridge, Colin Fleming, Paper Moon Trio, Quantum Mechanics, Four Leonards (and a Fifth), The Sherry Sebastian Trio, The Partisans, Doc Feldman with Art Shechet, The Joanna James Trio, Nevi’im, and Lauren Hill, Lorne Dechtenberg and Diane Arnson Svarlien.


“A startling Leonard Cohen Tribute…If there was a single concert event that underscored a sense of community this year it was the November summit honoring the songs of Leonard Cohen. There were wonderfully unspoiled and inventive interpretations of Cohen’s often prophetically poetic works that culminated with the artists and the audience singing ‘Hallelujah’ together…A rich and stylistically far-reaching overview.” -- Walter Tunis / Lexington Herald Leader


“For six decades, Leonard Cohen revealed his soul to the world through poetry and song—his deep time and timeless humanity touching our very core. Simply brilliant. His music and words will resonate forever.” –Rock and Roll Hall of Fame, 2008

Co-produced by the online cultural affairs publication UnderMain and Purple Carrots Productions.


Get your tickets early. The first show sold out quickly!
